message: Trying to boot into the CD (I also have a backup of the CD on a USB) so i can repair a drive. I hold down opt during boot and it comes up with the boot menu. I select CD and then nothing. Just sits with the apple logo forever. Ive tried the DVD that came with my laptop and a standard off the shelf OSX disk. Ive also tried resetting the PRAM. Anyone got a suggestion as to why this is happening?
Try holding the letter C during boot to bypass the selection process
I also pretty sure you can't boot off a USB without a little hacking
@undefined Sometimes it can be a problem with the HD that locks the bus, so the system never attempts to boot anything other than the HD.. to fix it you'd have to replace the HD.
@italiano40 Intel Macs natively support USB and Firewire booting. Apple Geniuses regularly boot off an external USB drive that has about 6 or 7 different versions of the OS when they debug problems.
@alexandru I have an intel Mac and it took me some hacking to get booting off a USB and I know it can boot off FireWire and the apple store actually does a network boot
@italiano40 not sure what's hacky about holding down Option on boot (http://support.apple.com/kb/ht1948) The only issue one might encounter is from using the low-powered USB port on a laptop.
